title: Mobile-Based Integrated Business Skills Learning: New Literacy-Centered Design

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental digital device usage skills and understanding of basic social concepts
context.additional_context: Customized content delivery reflecting individual learner levels and group learning needs, with VR/simulation-based situational business scenario experiences.

learning_goals: Learners enhance their business document writing skills by utilizing content that integrates text, images, and audio within a mobile application.

Learners can perform roles meeting evaluation criteria by applying communication strategies (active listening, context-specific language selection, nonverbal expression) with ≥80% accuracy across 3 VR simulation scenarios (meetings, customer consultations, team collaboration).
Learners acquire 100 essential business terms by accessing learning materials available anytime via mobile devices.

Learners can collaborate with 3–4 peers using digital tools (Miro, Trello, Slack) to design (proposal writing, role allocation) and execute a 4-week project addressing a real business problem (e.g., customer acquisition strategy), including 2 interim checkpoints and a final presentation, submitting deliverables that meet ≥4 of 5 evaluation criteria.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
